headline: 'The Five' on Biden begging Democrats to pass Build Back Better

utterances.speaker: AARON RODGERS, GREEN BAY PACKERS QUARTERBACK
utterances.sentences: It come in the crosshairs of the woke mob right now. So, before my final nail gets put in my canceled culture casket, I think I'd like to set the record straight. I'm not, you know, some sort of anti-vaxx flat-earther. I'm somebody who is a critical thinker. I believe strongly in bodily autonomy. And the ability to make choices for your body. Not to have to acquiesce to some woke culture or crazed, you know, group of individuals who say you have to do something.

utterances.speaker: RODGERS
utterances.sentences: The problem with this is it is so political. And health should not be political. When Trump in 2020 was championing these vaccines that were coming so quick what did the left say? And I'm talking about every member of the left. Don't trust the vaccine. Don't get the vaccine. You're going to die from the vaccine. And then what happened? Biden wins and everything flips.

utterances.speaker: DAGEN MCDOWELL, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: but you have Aaron Rodgers' hair so you are sympatico.

utterances.speaker: PETE HEGSETH, FOX NEWS CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Well, thank you very much. I also hated Brett Favre --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: -- until he came to purple. Aaron Rodgers you are going to replace Kirk Cousins, you are welcome any time.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Anybody can replace Kirk Cousins.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: In Minnesota, OK? And then maybe headed that way in Green Bay the way he felt about the Packers.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: If you watch the entire interview, it's really thoughtful. He breaks down the research that he did, what he knew about the vaccines, allergies that he had, reasons why he didn't want to take it. He went through when he called an immunization protocol which he didn't really get into the details of what that meant and said he talked to the league and the Packers about it. So, he's not someone that just dismissed the whole thing. Also, if you look at his comments over the last couple of years, this is where I'll get a little bit critical of him, he's been happy to go along with woke groupthink in the NFL.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: He has been the first to fly the flag. This is another example of, it's easy to go along with thorough woke mob until the mob comes for you and then pretty soon it's hey, the woke mob is after me and cancel culture. We'll see what the league ultimately does. He's out for a game or two, I believe. But this is the type of, this is yet another example, just like we saw from, who's the Orlando magic player that spoke up and talked about it?

utterances.speaker: LAWRENCE JONES, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: Kyrie is the main player.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Kyrie being -- having platforms, being thoughtful, thinking about their own personal health and making a personal decision. We'll see where the NFL goes there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Dagen, as Pete said, he has an allergy to the mRNA so he couldn't get the Pfizer. He couldn't get the Moderna and that left him with the J&J and he said that at the time that it was going down, the J&J got pulled for the week because of complications so this is what he did.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: And to Pete's point, I encourage everyone to watch every word of this interview because he really goes through all the conflicting information that has been fed to the American people over and over again where again, fomenting fear. Biden and Harris, when it benefited them in the campaign trail --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: -- and then when they turn around and get the jab. Now they are fomenting fear over and over again of that the vaccinated should be afraid of the unvaccinated which I'll get to in just one second. But then the J&J shot getting pulled and then put back on the market. And not -- and people were silenced. He goes into this, he said that, they made in the team, sent a stooge early into training camp to tell us we were 19th in the league and vaccination percentage. I challenge some of the things he was saying and afterwards I was thanked by a lot of coaches and players who were clearly quiet because they were worried about being shamed. And just one point. He said unvaccinated people are treated like they are the most dangerous people in society. And that is coming from the top of this nation on down. Joe Biden repeatedly has said I understand why you're angry and afraid of vaxx -- of unvaccinated people. He said, we have to protect vaccinated workers from the unvaccinated but then went on to say how effective the vaccines were. People who are unvaccinated get -- can get COVID from the vaccinated. And there is no evidence that people are dying who are vaccinated because they were in contact with unvaccinated. This is got to end and there's got to be a lot more discussion just like this around the country.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And Lawrence, we all know the most dangerous people in America are outside linebackers and those of the people need to be worried about.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: This is true. I'm too am, I'm a Cowboys fan so I have a conflict of interest.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. I can't be right now. I can't --

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: I know. We destroyed --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: This is a bad year for us.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Yes, it is.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Well, I am a Redskins fan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's always a bad year.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: It's only going to get worse for you guys so buckle up for the Cowboys.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Look, I'm no Rodgers fan. I think he is a jerk. I also think that Kyrie is a jerk but you need the jerks to win this battle right here. And Pete is right that they have touted the social justice agenda and they have been comfortable going with the mob. But this is an awakening period. They are understanding now what government will do. The other thing that hasn't been mentioned, is that Rodgers was being tested every single day.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: And we cannot not forget how the NBA was able to come back. Part the reason how we have these daily tests is because the NBA put them all in a bubble. They came up with a rapid test that everyone in the country is using today because of the NBA and it worked. People didn't get infected. And honestly, I think that's more effective than the people that are even vaccinated. Because someone that was vaccinated gave it to Rodgers is what they are saying.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: What he said.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: So, so --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: I think this is unfair to him. I don't like him but like I said, if we are going to win this fight, we need the jerks --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We need the jerks.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: -- to stand up to give us some --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We do need the jerks. And you now have to disclose who your team is before you weigh in.

utterances.speaker: JESSICA TARLOV, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: I don't really have a football team.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, OK, Jessica.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I am more into basketball.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. OK.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: It's just --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: It's safer anyway at this table.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: She is a Jets fan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. She just didn't want to say it.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I have been actually a Jets fan but I have not got along with it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Here we go.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: God bless.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Which is sad Sundays.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: And Thursday sometimes. No one has mentioned the critical component of this which is that Aaron Rodgers lied. And if Aaron Rodgers had answered the direct question, are you vaccinated, with no, I am not, I follow the protocols that have been laid out. I get tested every day, and admitted that the breaks masking protocol that the NFL has sent down, he'd be in a much better position now. This is someone who I think kind of universally has been decried over the last few months with what went on with Jeopardy, not showing up to camp. All of these things. And I'm not an Aaron Rodgers fan on a personal level I don't particularly enjoy him. But the lie is the problem here and when you do that, and then you continue to behave with the media as if you are vaccinated, you are endangering other people's lives. And Charles Barkley was saying the other night at the Halftime Show, he's talking about vaccine status and Kyrie. Kenny Smith was saying Kyrie was taking a stand. Charles Barkley made a point which is true, you get vaccinated to protect yourself but also to protect those around you.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: But didn't he go protect others by getting the test every single day?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: But he broke the rules and he lied to the American public.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: He got COVID and got tested and they isolated him. I think it worked.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: But he said -- and he also said --

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: It does not matter.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: He said that they knew that the team --

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: It doesn't matter. The media did not know who --

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: No, no, no. The media is the one that deserves to know. In fact, he said if they had asked the follow-up question which they didn't, I would have answered it. But I asked and he said --

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Really? That's convenient for him to say as he sits on a couch with his friends.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: He said he owed to the media. He talked to Packers --

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: He does. You owe it to them on a health basis.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: -- about the protocols.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: They should be socially distance.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: They're not.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: They should be socially distance.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: And there are other players on the Packers who are not vaccinated and they take their media avails through Zoom like responsible people. And Aaron Rodgers walks around shoulder to shoulder with people who may be vaccinated, may not be vaccinated, whatever it is who may have a pre- existing condition or comorbidity or whatever it that makes it more dangerous for them to do that.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Or the (Inaudible) have taken the test every single day to prove.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He has taken the test every day.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Because that's how he got it.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: His friends --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: He mentioned, he said was it before the season, that the vaccinated people on the team were getting tested every two weeks. He was getting tested every day.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Every day.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: And he said and the biggest issue for him was, we had a doctor. He was challenging his status with the team and presented hundreds of pages of information about his immunization course. This, you know, what appears to be homeopathic. But he said a doctor from the league told him, quote, "it was impossible for a vaccinated person to get or spread COVID." And we all know that is not true.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: That's a lie.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: But did Aaron Rodgers lie? Because that's what --

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: He also points out the protocols for unvaccinated players.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: And so, the Democrats during the presidential campaign saying that they shouldn't trust the vaccine.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And that is a good point.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Can I add -- can I add one more thing?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That is a good point, Lawrence.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: He looks greasy and sick. So, if he's going to brag about his health, maybe like, clean up a little before you sit in front of a camera, Pete.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: It's how he always looks.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right, all right. Let's go, jerks. That's what this is about. Coming up, more humiliation and disarray for Democrats as President Biden begs them to pass his agenda.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.sentences: I'm asking every House number, member of the House of Representatives, to vote yes on both of these bills right now. Send the infrastructure bill to my desk. Send the Build Back Better bill to the Senate.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Joe Manchin, why won't you fight for me?

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Joe Manchin, is it worth it? Is the money worth it? Is the money that important, Joe Manchin? Is it more important than my life, Joe Manchin? Is it more important than your kids' life?

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Joe Manchin, is the money worth than our lives?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Why is not he a Republican? Just get on with that already.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Come on over, Joe. It's nicer on this side. The Democrat leadership is very old, Dagen, and the older you get the more stubborn you get. You're laughing because you're not even 30, Lawrence. But you'll get to where we are soon.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: True.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Joe Biden is so old, he proposed to his wife eight times before she said yes. Nancy is 81. Have you ever met an 81-year-old who change their mind about anything? Manchin is old too. He is sitting in that Maserati as he gets mob. You can see his blood was boiling. That's going to make him go on the other direction. Pistol Pete probably would've put the pedal to the metal and just squashed these climate activists.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: He showed some self-restraint.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He showed some self-restraint. But here's the other thing with Manchin. Manchin has money on the line in West Virginia. His entire portfolio is coal. He's got millions in coal. His family has got a coal brokerage firm. You take the politics and you take the policy up. Do you think Joe Manchin is going to vote for the Green New Deal in this bill? It's going to destroy his entire bank account, not to mention the entire bank account in West Virginia. So, there is no way he is putting a yes vote on this. Nancy Pelosi is going to retire probably in 2022 when they lose the House. So, the gavel is toast in just nine months or whatever. She knows this. She's going to Europe next week. She's going to jam this through. Do you guys remember how they did Obamacare? The corn husker kickback, the Louisiana purchase? They just started bribing congressmen and senators. That's what Nancy has been doing this whole last week. She's bribing these holdouts with pharma money. You know, they do this salt taffy bribe --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- before this New England congressmen. That's all that's happening. They'll just bribe it to death and jam it through.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Come on. They get rid -- they reintroduce the salt reduction. You're on board with salt.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I already said I'm on board with salt.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Lawrence?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: I'm siding with the progressives on this. And I'm going to tell you why. The progressives didn't change. They are in line with the new Democratic Party. They were promised things on the campaign trail, even though Joe Biden said he was a moderate, the policies that he was putting now were consistent with the progressive caucus. You got Manchin, who is a squish when it comes to the Democrats. I think the progressives should hold the line. And by the way, Nancy Pelosi and the leadership should stop doing press conferences. They keep saying that they have reached an agreement. They have not reached an agreement. They have lost voter turnout. Part of that and we talked about this before we got on. The progressives being on this is that, they didn't lose this election. That the turnout was so low is because they didn't deliver on what they said they were going to deliver for the American people, and quite frankly I agree with him. Now I think they are bad, you know what, crazy. But at the end of the day if you tell your electorate that they are going to do something and you don't do it, you should be held accountable.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Jess?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Well, since Lawrence is playing progressive today, I guess I can hang in the moderate wing. I think that they should pass infrastructure as fast as possible and frankly should have done it six weeks ago when they got the go-ahead from the Senate. And that's something that hugely popular with the American public, they had what, seven, eight Republican senators on board.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: It's a win.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: It's a win for everybody. Infrastructure always works that way. And then everyone has something to go into the midterms with. The American rescue plan plus infrastructure. Republicans will have infrastructure. I don't know when this gets passed. Probably next week that it goes through because the progressive caucus wants them to come together. But to Lawrence's point about our previous conversation, I think it is really important when a party is taking two different lessons from an election outcome, you're going to end up with a lot of fissures in the immediate aftermath. Because there are a lot of moderate Democrats that are worried about their midterm fate because of what they saw in Virginia, that New Jersey was obviously closer than it should've been even though Phil Murphy pulled off an incredible feat. No one -- no Democrat has been reelected since 1977 to the governorship. And all of this also takes away from being able to talk about very real accomplishments, like today's jobs report. Five hundred thirty-one jobs added --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Well, let me add --

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: -- in August and September. Revised that 4.8 --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: -- unemployment rate, five million jobs added in total, Dow all- time highs. These are things the Democrats need to be focused on and not the infighting.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: All right, 4.6 unemployment rate because it fell one-tenth of a percent. So that's even better news. But on that note, --

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I love it.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: -- Mr. Hegseth, Biden today said we need these bills to put the pandemic behind us. The pandemic is over. This is -- this evidence on the economy. We are coming out of this. The economy is growing. Pandemic over. And also as evident, Biden last week when he was campaigning for Terry McAuliffe, he was armpit to armpit with people in a liberal mosh pit. No mask anywhere. Pandemic is over.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: So that's a garbage way they are temping to sell it. I think the bigger dynamic here is what happened in Virginia and New Jersey. And Jesse, you mentioned the cornhusker kickback in the Louisiana purchase. How many members of Congress that were part of those deals are still members of Congress?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You're right.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Because eventually it comes back to you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: And so, it's Gottheimer and the others in the moderate wing of the Democrat Party, they are saying, hey, how about we hold out 72 hours so we can read the 2,000-page socialist bill --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: -- that doesn't even have a CBO score right now.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: So, Nancy wants yet again to pass the bill so that we can find out what's in it. We have no idea what's in it. They know it, they are breaking -- we were going to go back to norms in the House of Representatives, right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: They held the vote open longer than any vote before.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: No more regular order.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: There is no regular order at all. She is jamming this through. They say that it's going to reduce the deficit.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: I mean, the Wall Street Journal is pointing out today it's actually a $4 trillion bill and the infrastructure bill that the left love so much, if only there were some infrastructure in there.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: The left and the right.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Because most of it is human infrastructure. No. Most Republicans they're not voting for that one.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Mitch McConnell is not squish?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Most Republicans are not going to vote for that bill because they recognize what it really is, a precursor to the Green New Deal. So, it's really bad. I hope they --

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: I just don't understand how we can continue -- continue call Nancy Pelosi a master legislator with all this chaos happening.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: When you can't pass.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: I mean, the progressives just kicked her out of their meeting last week. So.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: You just wait.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Well, and then Medicare --

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Well, the keep waiting.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: -- Medicare House bill trust fund runs out of money in less than five years and you're going to get a 9 percent benefit decrease. What about that? Coming up, the Biden administration apparently thinks high are hilarious. The tone-deaf comments next.

utterances.speaker: TOM KEENE, HOST, BLOOMBERG RADIO
utterances.sentences: In Sturgis, Michigan, it is $2.89 a gallon. I guess that's better than in California. What is the Granholm plan to increase oil production in America?

utterances.speaker: JENNIFER GRANHOLM, U.S. SECRETARY OF ENERGY
utterances.sentences: That is hilarious. Would that I had the magic wand on this oil. It is a global market. It is controlled by a cartel. That cartel is called OPEC. And they made the decision yesterday that they were not going to increase beyond what they were already planning.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Yes. It reminds me of Obama talking about the magic wand as well which didn't come back to him either. I mean, what Joe Biden did when the election, right before the elections in Virginia and New Jersey, was completely emblematic of the disconnect you're talking about, Lawrence.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: He is over in Glasgow. He is over in Italy talking about climate change and emissions while people on the campaign trail are talking about curriculum in schools, inflation, our border, a retreat in Afghanistan. All the things that pertain to their lives and our nation's honor. They are talk -- they are protesting at Joe Manchin, save my life. I'm about to die because of climate change and they're listening to those things. In this particular case they listen so much that they undercut our own energy independence at home and then laugh and say well, it's a cartel, and OPEC and we need to beg them for more oil. What do you want me to do? What do you want me to do? Not cancels our pipelines. Not crush our ability to create domestic opportunities here at home. So, the only one laughing is us at them with the sheer incompetence they've had so far in handling this.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Yes. But, Dagen, there's a message coming out of the White House and the Democratic Party at large is that, nothing is happening. They're doing well. It's not their fault. It's a demand issue. Every single issue they are excelling and the American people are rejecting them. So, when are they going to get a clue?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: They won't. I will say at this table what I said watching this, screaming it out loud in my office by myself listening to the energy secretary. Is it too much to ask that the Secretary of Energy actually understands how the energy sector works and how energy production works? Is it too much to ask for her to give at least a small, cold damn about the suffering that all Americans are facing as they tried to say, oh, do I eat spaghetti for dinner or do I buy a steak because I've got to fill up my car tomorrow morning? Let me just point this. What she said was totally disingenuous. The United States broke OPEC, broke the cartel. We became a net exporter of oil and oil products under President Trump. We became the world's swing producer. That means that we control the global price of oil because we had so much spare production capacity. So, she's talking about OPEC can change their price. It's a global commodity. We control the price until you took a chainsaw, you and your liberal nuts to one of our most valuable industries, and took a chainsaw to our global security. You handed power to nations that hate us. That's -- and she can laugh about that too.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Jessica, should the president summons her to the oval? He campaigned on President empathy. This doesn't seem very empathetic.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: It's not a good idea to laugh at voters. And you're laughing at voters also of your own party. It's 80 percent of America's upset about inflation right now. That's wide swaths majorities of everyone, independents, the most alongside Republicans, but Democrats are feeling the heat to along with these prices. And to return to the empathy point is Joe Biden won this election by being empathetic and saying I can get us through this global health pandemic. I'm the right guy to do that. And you saw that coming up as a problem specifically in the Virginia election. You can't dismiss the way people feel you have to keep talking to them. This was the same thing that they found over and over with getting people to take the vaccine. Don't tell them that they're an idiot because they don't want to take it. Explain the benefits of it. utterances.utterance: And to Pete's point, I encourage everyone to watch every word of this interview because he really goes through all the conflicting information that has been fed to the American people over and over again where again, fomenting fear. Biden and Harris, when it benefited them in the campaign trail --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: -- and then when they turn around and get the jab. Now they are fomenting fear over and over again of that the vaccinated should be afraid of the unvaccinated which I'll get to in just one second. But then the J&J shot getting pulled and then put back on the market. And not -- and people were silenced. He goes into this, he said that, they made in the team, sent a stooge early into training camp to tell us we were 19th in the league and vaccination percentage. I challenge some of the things he was saying and afterwards I was thanked by a lot of coaches and players who were clearly quiet because they were worried about being shamed. And just one point. He said unvaccinated people are treated like they are the most dangerous people in society. And that is coming from the top of this nation on down. Joe Biden repeatedly has said I understand why you're angry and afraid of vaxx -- of unvaccinated people. He said, we have to protect vaccinated workers from the unvaccinated but then went on to say how effective the vaccines were. People who are unvaccinated get -- can get COVID from the vaccinated. And there is no evidence that people are dying who are vaccinated because they were in contact with unvaccinated. This is got to end and there's got to be a lot more discussion just like this around the country.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And Lawrence, we all know the most dangerous people in America are outside linebackers and those of the people need to be worried about.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: This is true. I'm too am, I'm a Cowboys fan so I have a conflict of interest.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK. I can't be right now. I can't --

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: I know. We destroyed --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: This is a bad year for us.

utterances.speaker: JONES

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Well, I am a Redskins fan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's always a bad year.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: It's only going to get worse for you guys so buckle up for the Cowboys.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Look, I'm no Rodgers fan. I think he is a jerk. I also think that Kyrie is a jerk but you need the jerks to win this battle right here. And Pete is right that they have touted the social justice agenda and they have been comfortable going with the mob. But this is an awakening period. They are understanding now what government will do. The other thing that hasn't been mentioned, is that Rodgers was being tested every single day.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: And we cannot not forget how the NBA was able to come back. Part the reason how we have these daily tests is because the NBA put them all in a bubble. They came up with a rapid test that everyone in the country is using today because of the NBA and it worked. People didn't get infected. And honestly, I think that's more effective than the people that are even vaccinated. Because someone that was vaccinated gave it to Rodgers is what they are saying.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: What he said.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: So, so --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: I think this is unfair to him. I don't like him but like I said, if we are going to win this fight, we need the jerks --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We need the jerks.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: -- to stand up to give us some --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We do need the jerks. And you now have to disclose who your team is before you weigh in.

utterances.speaker: JESSICA TARLOV, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: I don't really have a football team.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, OK, Jessica.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: I am more into basketball.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK. OK.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: It's just --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: It's safer anyway at this table.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: She is a Jets fan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. She just didn't want to say it.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: I have been actually a Jets fan but I have not got along with it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Here we go.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: God bless.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Which is sad Sundays.

utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: And Thursday sometimes. No one has mentioned the critical component of this which is that Aaron Rodgers lied. And if Aaron Rodgers had answered the direct question, are you vaccinated, with no, I am not, I follow the protocols that have been laid out. I get tested every day, and admitted that the breaks masking protocol that the NFL has sent down, he'd be in a much better position now. This is someone who I think kind of universally has been decried over the last few months with what went on with Jeopardy, not showing up to camp. All of these things. And I'm not an Aaron Rodgers fan on a personal level I don't particularly enjoy him. But the lie is the problem here and when you do that, and then you continue to behave with the media as if you are vaccinated, you are endangering other people's lives. And Charles Barkley was saying the other night at the Halftime Show, he's talking about vaccine status and Kyrie. Kenny Smith was saying Kyrie was taking a stand. Charles Barkley made a point which is true, you get vaccinated to protect yourself but also to protect those around you.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: But didn't he go protect others by getting the test every single day?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: But he broke the rules and he lied to the American public.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: He got COVID and got tested and they isolated him. I think it worked.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: But he said -- and he also said --

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: It does not matter.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: He said that they knew that the team --

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: It doesn't matter. The media did not know who --

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: No, no, no. The media is the one that deserves to know. In fact, he said if they had asked the follow-up question which they didn't, I would have answered it. But I asked and he said --

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Really? That's convenient for him to say as he sits on a couch with his friends.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: He said he owed to the media. He talked to Packers --

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
